intro: Cnemidostachys campestris, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation programs.
